name: Systemair
0:
”Alexa, tell system air to activate crowded”
”Alexa, ask system air when I need a new filter”
”Alexa, ask system air what my carbon dioxide level is”
skdetail:
This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: system air
Developer Terms of Use
des:
This skill is designed for user to control their ventilation system by voice commands with Alexa Help.

To be able to give commands for Alexa to control Systemair SAVE Unit, user must link his Alexa with specific Systemair SAVE Unit. Linking can be done in SAVE CONNECT mobile application or WEB page (https://homesolutions.systemair.com/). The Pin Code for Alexa linking can be generated in Device Linking menu. 

Amazon Alexa will understand following commands:
1. Change Air Flow Level - User can tell Alexa to Change airflow Level on Systemair device.
2. Change User Mode - User can tell Alexa to Change User Mode on Systemair device and additionally set delay for that mode. 
3. Filter Time - User can ask Alexa when he needs to replace Filter on his Systemair device.
4. Carbon Dioxide Level - User can ask Alexa what carbon dioxide level is in his room, which Systemair device is tracking.
5. Outdoor Air Temperature - User can ask Alexa what the outside temperature is, which Systemair device is tracking. 
6. Room Air Temperature - User can ask Alexa what his room air temperature is, which Systemair device is tracking.
7. Humidity Level - User can ask Alexa what humidity level in his room, which Systemair device is tracking.
8. Set Delay - User can tell Alexa to set delay which will be automatically used for other user modes on Systemair device.
9. Set Temperature Setpoint - User can tell Alexa change temperature setpoint on Systemair device.
